description: A prehistoric island in Paradise inhabited by dinosaurs and two giant warriors, Dorry and Brogy, who have been dueling for 100 years.

keyEvents.title: Sanji Impersonates Mr. 3
keyEvents.description: At Little Garden, Sanji receives a call from Crocodile and cleverly impersonates Mr. 3 to deceive the Warlord.
keyEvents.significance: This deception allows the crew to obtain the Eternal Pose to Arabasta.

keyEvents.title: Straw Hats Leave Little Garden
keyEvents.description: The Straw Hat Pirates depart from Little Garden on the Going Merry, setting course for Arabasta.
keyEvents.significance: Marks the conclusion of the Little Garden Arc.

keyEvents.title: Hakoku Technique Unleashed
keyEvents.description: Near Little Garden's shore, Dorry and Brogy use their combined Hakoku technique to destroy the Island Eater.
keyEvents.significance: Final farewell gesture from the giants to protect the departing Straw Hats.

statusHistory.reason: Island remains inhabited by dinosaurs and the two giants

description: A casino in Rainbase, Arabasta, which serves as Crocodile's base of operations and the headquarters of Baroque Works.

keyEvents.title: Crocodile Orders Mr. 2 to Eliminate Mr. 3
keyEvents.description: From Rain Dinners, Crocodile instructs Miss All-Sunday to have Mr. 2 Bon Clay eliminate the real Mr. 3.
keyEvents.significance: First glimpse of Crocodile's headquarters and his ruthless leadership of Baroque Works.

statusHistory.reason: Casino is operational and serving as Baroque Works headquarters

description: A massive goldfish larger than islands that inhabits the sea near Little Garden. Known for swallowing entire ships and even islands, making it the main reason ships leaving Little Garden never reached their destination.

keyEvents.title: Island Eater Appears
keyEvents.description: The Island Eater emerges from the ocean and swallows the Going Merry whole as the Straw Hats attempt to leave Little Garden.
keyEvents.significance: Validates Usopp's tall tale about a giant goldfish and creates immediate danger for the crew.

keyEvents.title: Island Eater Defeated
keyEvents.description: The Island Eater is killed by Dorry and Brogy's Hakoku attack, which slices the massive goldfish in half.
keyEvents.significance: The giants save the Straw Hats with this final act of friendship.

statusHistory.reason: Killed by Dorry and Brogy's Hakoku technique
Sliced in half by Hakoku attack
